intro: Misopates font-queri, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Misopates font-queri is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, showcasing its adaptability to diverse ecological conditions.
